result.execSummary:
The defendant Favian Ramos was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Impairment of Physical Condition, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.  Defendant was ordered to report immediately to the probation and parole office.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.
Costs of the action paid from bond previously posted.
Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request.
Defendant is not to have any violent or otherwise abusive contact with the victim, K.C.

timeConds.notes: Defendant granted huber privileges and credit for 3 days served. Defendant is to report on or before 9-15-2015 at 7pm and may serve his sentence in Taylor County provided he can make those arrangements. Privilege of transfer is denied if it results in electronic monitoring.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Huber granted.  Defendant was granted 102 days credit for time served.  If not already done so,  Defendant is ordered to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.  The cost for the DNA sample has already been paid

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
